title: Ryan Reynolds shares sweet first snap of third child with Blake Lively
text:
Blake Lively and Ryan Reynolds welcomed a baby girl (Picture: Twitter/Getty)

Ryan Reynolds has shared the first picture of his new child with wife Blake Lively, and seemingly confirmed they welcomed a third daughter.

Ryan, 42, took to Twitter to encourage fans to consider climate change and the ongoing impact it has on the world when they begin voting in Canadian elections.

He also shared a sweet picture of him and Blake with their new baby girl – whose face was covered up with a spot of Photoshop.

The pair are already parents to two girls – James, four, and three-year-old Inez.

He captioned his tweet: ‘I want my daughters to experience the same natural playground I grew up in.’

‘I want my daughters to experience the same natural playground I grew up in,’ he tweeted. (Picture: Twitter)

Blake confirmed her pregnancy earlier this year, unveiling her baby bump on the red carpet at the Pokemon Detective Pikachu premiere in May.

But although sources recently alleged the pair welcomed their little girl around early August, Ryan joked he had been telling the unborn tot to ‘stay in’ Blake’s womb.

Blake Lively and Ryan Reynolds confirmed their third pregnancy in May (Picture: FilmMagic)

He shared a series of pictures on Blake’s 32nd birthday in which she either had her eyes closed or was completely out of frame, and with the first image showing Blake’s baby bump one fan commented: ‘Get that baby outta there!!!’

But Ryan joked: ‘I keep whispering, “stay in…”‘

Blake, 32, recently opened u on their parenting style with the little ones, admitting she was just ‘figuring out what the heck’ to do.

‘I think it’s hard to slap labels on any parents because it’s just so tricky,’ the Serena Van Der Woodsen actress told People.

‘It’s like every moment you’re figuring out what the heck you’re doing. You think, “Ooh, should I be more strict, or should I be more I don’t know, emotional?” Or whatever it is.

‘If anybody knows how to be a parent, I feel like grandparents really know how to be parents. But parents, you just figure it out as you go. So, I wouldn’t put a label on it.’
